page.title: 17BERRYNARBORS GREAT FIRE
page.content: In the centre of Berrynarbor Village almost opposithe the church steps is a guest house known now az Bessemer Thatch. It was originally three cottages and one of the owneers was called Bess Emery..this is wher the name comes from. The original cottages were thatched but a spark from a chimney caught the thatch on fire and burned the roof of the cottges and the top floors.Also involved in the fire was the house next door which used to be the forge. The fire brigade from Ilfracombe arrived but this was in the mid 1930's and the fire was well under way when they arrived. During the following threedays the village school was closed because the Head Mistress of the school lived at the Old Forge.
